sentences.en: Air travel has caused a revolution in our way of living.
sentences.cn: 空中旅行使我们的生活方式完全变了.

sentences.en: As the " revolution of rising expectation " was met, political stability would follow almost automatically.
sentences.cn: 在 “ 日益增长变化的期望 ” 得到满足时, 几乎自然而然地会出现政治上的稳定.

sentences.en: He was afraid the revolution they had started would fail.
sentences.cn: 他担心他们发起的大变革会遭遇失败。

sentences.en: His death made a revolution in favour of the two distressed families.
sentences.cn: 他一死,这两个困苦的家庭有了转机.

sentences.en: I repeat that medicine is on the brink of a revolution.
sentences.cn: 我要再次强调，医学面临着变革。

sentences.en: In addition, a virtual revolution took place in the more important area of national politics.
sentences.cn: 此外, 在全国政治这个更重要的领域里,出现过一场实质性变革.

sentences.en: Lavoisier realized that this was a discovery which would bring about a tremendous revolution in chemistry.
sentences.cn: 拉瓦锡认识到这是个可能导致化学发生极大变革的发现.

sentences.en: On the eve of the Revolution, the colonies produced thirty thousand tons of crude iron a year.
sentences.cn: 独立战争前夕，北美十三州每年生产3万吨生铁。

sentences.en: She philosophically noted dates as they came past in the revolution of the year.
sentences.cn: 她拿哲学家冷静清醒的眼光,注意那些岁月循环中去而复来的日子.

sentences.en: The automobile caused a revolution in our way of traveling.
sentences.cn: 汽车使旅行的方式发生了根本性的变化.

sentences.en: The feeding of dairy cows has undergone a revolution.
sentences.cn: 乳牛的喂养方法发生了巨大的改变。

sentences.en: The leader's assassination led to political convulsions, eg an attempt at revolution.
sentences.cn: 领导人遇剌引起了政治动乱.

sentences.en: The nineteenth century witnessed a revolution in ship design and propulsion.
sentences.cn: 19世纪船舶设计和船舶动力领域发生了重大的变革。

sentences.en: the planets’ revolution around the sun
The revolution of the earth causes day and night.
sentences.cn: 地球的自转形成白天和夜晚.

sentences.en: What is the instantaneous center of revolution?
sentences.cn: 瞬时转动中心在 哪里 ?

旋转；循环出现；反复考虑

科技革命；[经]工业技术革命

trans.tran_en: a complete change in ways of thinking, methods of working etc
